text: Hallard Leo "Snow" White (27 March 1929 - 14 July 2016) was a New Zealand rugby union player. White played a record 195 games for Rut Auckland between 1950 and 1963. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the All Blacks, from 1953 to 1955, appearing in 16 matches including four internationals. Following his retirement as a player, White served in both coaching and administrative roles: as assistant coach of Auckland; president of the Auckland Rugby Football Union from 1989 to 1989; and president of the New Zealand Rugby Union in 1990. White died on 14 July 2016 from Alzheimer's disease, aged 87. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:New Zealand rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from Auckland
title: Hallard White
